Parent.Title: Validate user email
Parent.Notes: To verify user email is unique.

Parent.Title: Content management
Parent.Notes: To get latest CMS data.

Parent.Title: User sign up
Parent.Success Response: Code: 200, Content: {"message":"Thank you for registering with us. Soon you will get a confirmation email to verify your account"}
Parent.Notes: Takes input as user email and sends an email to user inorder active the account.

Parent.Title: User account forgot password
Parent.Success Response: Code: 200, Content: {"message":"Successfully sent new generated password to mounica.kokkerlapati@mtuity.com with further instructions."}
Parent.Notes: User gets email notification with an url to change password.

Parent.Title: Resend email notification
Parent.Success Response: Code: 200, Content: {"message":"Thank you for registering with us. Soon you will get a confirmation email to verify your account"}
Parent.Notes: User gets email notification with an url to activate the account. This api used for signup module and "resendemail" for forgot password will be the same api which is used for forgot password.

Parent.Title: Activate account
Parent.Notes: To activate account through a token which is assigned in registeration process.

Parent.Title: Reset password
Parent.Notes: To reset password.

Parent.Title: Application login
Parent.Notes: User sign in to application and this api generates a token with an expireTime.

Parent.Title: Content management
Parent.Notes: To update user's content management data.

Parent.Title: Application's terms
Parent.Notes: To get application's updated terms of service.

Parent.Title: Application's privacy
Parent.Notes: To get application's updated privacy policy.

Parent.Title: Application's Warranty
Parent.Notes: To get application's updated warranty information.

Parent.Title: Application logout
Parent.Notes: This api removes user's token and session data.

Parent.Title: User news feeds
Parent.Success Response:
Code: 200, Content:[{"title":"discovers shape and letter recognition","description":"Square Panda is a hit with kids, parents, and grandparents!  Play at home or play at school.  The options are limitless.  

Upload photos to the Square Panda playground, and see them appear in your games.  Your child will delight at seeing your face when he plays MOM or DAD.","full_view":"Square Panda is a hit with kids, parents, and grandparents!  Play at home or play at school.  The options are limitless.  

Upload photos to the Square Panda playground, and see them appear in your games.  Your child will delight at seeing your face when he plays MOM or DAD.","category":"SP_PRODUCTS","image_url":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/78bf90e4-5148-4fba-a0ab-5b930d02483f.jpg","status":"PUBLISH","user_id":"ADMIN","createdAt":"2016-06-23T06:44:50.758Z","updatedAt":"2016-11-18T05:22:01.883Z","id":"576b8562abfaad3e6c3b3b5a"}]
Parent.Notes: To get all user achievements and application related news data.

Parent.Title: All players
Parent.Notes: To get all players for a particular user.

Parent.Title: Single player data
Parent.Notes: To get player data.

Parent.Title: Player highlights
Parent.Notes: To get player's highlights such as most recent word, played time and favorite word.

Parent.Title: Grid view of bigbadges
Parent.Success Response:
Code: 200, Content:[{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Letters and Phonemes","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/8aa2afb8-c053-4f28-810d-f8fdc4a77d8b.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/80ce35f6-4764-40c9-b95f-f20bde8603fa.png","createdAt":"2016-04-11T05:56:16.925Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T05:56:16.925Z","description":"After phonological awareness (awareness of the auditory sounds of words), letter recognition and phonemic awareness are the first steps to reading readiness! Your child will learn all 26 letters of the alphabet and the 44 individual phonemic sounds those letters and letter combinations create.","tabwords":["a","b","c","d","e"],"colorCode":"#ad84ff","incrementflag":1,"milestoneIds":["1"],"id":"570b3c801df04f0c123c93bc","percentage":80.76923076923077,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Rhymes","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/75798d45-afad-4b1d-a100-33e91ee62711.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/1cd01dc7-15db-4eac-b39d-ecb290ade98f.png","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:31:49.314Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:31:49.314Z","description":"This badge represents a crucial step in phonemic awareness and reading readiness as your child learns about rhymes and word families! This badge means your child is also now identifying words with the same rime (yes, this skill is spelled rime!) The rime is the part of the word after the initial consonant sound - so the "AT" sound in CAT and BAT. Help your child swap out the onset (beginning consonant letter sound) and watch how the word changes!","tabwords":["at","in","an","ub","ow"],"colorCode":"#65b3eb","incrementflag":2,"milestoneIds":["2"],"id":"570b44d51df04f0c123c93da","percentage":0,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"CVC","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/741a332d-1572-4c17-8fc1-82bc6ed26d1f.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/e3240ad9-b43a-494a-aacc-15ccecc2cf87.png","description":"This badge is for words that follow this pattern: consonant, vowel, consonant! This pattern is the basic building block of English word construction.","tabwords":["cat","bed","pig","cow","hut"],"colorCode":"#ff8b65","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:25:31.039Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:25:31.039Z","incrementflag":3,"milestoneIds":["3"],"id":"570b435b1df04f0c123c93c8","percentage":0,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Sight","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/62374ee9-3730-41e0-b425-94e70a4464f3.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/c54afdde-c4dd-4447-8af0-149e8c6dbe03.png","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:29:14.853Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:29:14.853Z","description":"As you know, the English language is tricky! There are some words that your child has to learn to memorize because they don't follow traditional rules and conventions. These words are called sight words and include the ever popular 'the," "to" and "want."","tabwords":["the","to","want","was","give"],"colorCode":"#e86bcb","incrementflag":4,"milestoneIds":["4.1","4.2","4.3","4.4"],"id":"570b443a1df04f0c123c93d2","percentage":2.515723270440252,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Compound","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/e4594caf-0d81-42b1-9327-b7860c6bc9e0.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/ea651c71-adaa-4bbc-98eb-dd782380b250.png","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:28:29.582Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:28:29.582Z","description":"This badge is for when your child learns to combine two words together create one longer word. This is called a compound word! Words in this group include cupcake, hotdog and upset.","tabwords":["sunset","hotdog","upset","cupcake","jigsaw"],"colorCode":"#6bc3c3","incrementflag":5,"milestoneIds":["5"],"id":"570b440d1df04f0c123c93d0","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Digraphs","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/b1457d93-ef70-4928-b287-424d0edec0f1.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/5c56ef9b-8a58-4a13-8713-65a0c1451eb0.png","description":"Digraphs are when two letters combine to create a brand new sound! Your child is learning these new phonemic sounds, including fish (shhhh!) and chip (chhh!)","tabwords":["chip","shop","fish","thorn","third"],"colorCode":"#4cbbe4","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:23:40.825Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:23:40.825Z","incrementflag":6,"milestoneIds":["6"],"id":"570b42ec1df04f0c123c93c6","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Blends","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/4172a5b7-1445-4099-9534-9e644224ea4f.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/4712acb1-5a7d-4b0b-a10e-1b87ec3fe38d.png","description":"Blends are when two letters combine and still create their individual sounds. Such as 'brick,' 'trip' (tuh, rrr!) and 'star' (suhh, tuh!)","tabwords":["brick","trip","star","blur","land"],"colorCode":"#efd157","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:00:33.114Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:00:33.114Z","incrementflag":7,"milestoneIds":["7.1"],"id":"570b3d811df04f0c123c93c2","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Floss Rule","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/7a7934dd-9180-416e-8642-b404c0e20d28.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/244cc84b-d55d-4ae0-9535-39ea5f96f8c7.png","description":"When a /f/, /l/ /s/ (or /z/) follows a short vowel at the end of a one-syllable word, the consonant is doubled “ff”, “ll”, “ss” or “zz”.","tabwords":["hill","mess","moss","buzz","riff"],"colorCode":"#90b868","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:26:29.537Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:26:29.537Z","incrementflag":8,"milestoneIds":["7.2","7.3","7.4"],"id":"570b43951df04f0c123c93ca","percentage":92.5925925925926,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Silent E","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Silent_E_Web.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Silent_E_WebDisabled.png","description":"Long vowels are vowels (A, E, I, O, U) that make the same phonemic sound as their name. So the letter 'a' makes
the sound 'Aye!' in 'day' rather than 'Aaa' in 'cat!' Children are typically taught short vowel sounds before they learn long vowel sounds because
they tend to follow more traditional conventions. When an 'e' is added to a word with a vowel, it changes the vowel sound to a long vowel","tabwords":["like","bike","lake","bake","snake"],"colorCode":"#ad84ff","createdAt":"4/11/2016 5:56:06 AM","updatedAt":"4/11/2016 5:56:06 AM","incrementflag":9,"milestoneIds":["8.1","8.2","8.3","8.4"],"id":"570b3d561df04f0c123c93c0","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Y as a Vowel","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/7c48930f-b6e2-4aa1-97c7-eb48ebb20521.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/113ca738-051c-47ee-a47d-f3e5e30579f7.png","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:29:49.439Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:29:49.439Z","description":"The letter 'Y' is sometimes used as a vowel sound. In the word 'sky' the 'y' makes the 'i' sound. Check back with Square Panda later for a special 'Y' letter set!","tabwords":["sky","copy","daddy","baby","cycle"],"colorCode":"#4cbbe4","incrementflag":10,"milestoneIds":["9.2"],"id":"570b445d1df04f0c123c93d4","percentage":15.789473684210526,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Double Vowel","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/b042007e-4620-4775-a55c-e04ce945c6d4.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/9b35540b-bc9a-460c-8458-ece68dd52704.png","description":"Common double vowel combinations can be tricky because they create a new sound that is not always a match to the vowels. One trick for your child to remember is 'when two vowels go walking the first does the talking.' This means we pronounce the first vowel and the second is silent.","tabwords":["bear","bee","tree","day","boat"],"colorCode":"#efd157","createdAt":"2016-06-08T07:44:27.142Z","updatedAt":"2016-06-08T07:44:27.142Z","incrementflag":10,"milestoneIds":["8.2","8.3"],"id":"5757ccdb7c8337141e4e9a8a","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"R Control","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/e9303129-acd3-4d4a-bf17-db994502ef67.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/f62b8d17-0f2b-4538-9ade-56c754f43771.png","description":"That 'R' can be so controlling! Did you know that words with 'r's' often change the vowel sounds in words? An example is the word 'car.' Because of the 'r' at the
end of the word, the 'a' sound becomes a short vowel sound.","tabwords":["car","bird","yard","part","bar"],"colorCode":"#90b868","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:01:06.842Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:01:06.842Z","incrementflag":11,"milestoneIds":["10"],"id":"570b3da21df04f0c123c93c4","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"OO","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/OO_Web.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/OO_WebDisabled.png","description":"When you combine two vowels like 'oo' in 'food,' it also creates a new sound 'ew!' ","tabwords":["food","mood","good","school"],"colorCode":"#65b3eb","createdAt":"2016-06-08T07:24:59.114Z","updatedAt":"2016-06-08T07:24:59.114Z","incrementflag":11.5,"milestoneIds":["10"],"id":"5757c84b7c8337141e4e9a78","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"IGH","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/ebecb2f8-968a-4810-9e32-dba2e6ceb746.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/0c7d298f-a1d2-4fee-8d9d-02b416e5097e.png","description":"The letter combination 'igh' makes the long 'i' sound. The words 'night' 'light' and 'fight' sound exactly like: n-i-t-e, l-i-t-e, and f-i-t-e.","tabwords":["light","mighty","flight","right","sight"],"colorCode":"#e86bcb","createdAt":"2016-04-11T06:27:40.802Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T06:27:40.802Z","incrementflag":12,"milestoneIds":["11.1","11.2"],"id":"570b43dc1df04f0c123c93ce","percentage":0,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"Double Vowel + R Control","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/49abf0bc-bee8-4792-915e-3ffd55c1569b.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/c928a9c6-7ac1-4287-aa38-7a9a44403883.png","description":"When you have two vowels next to one another, letter r's next to one another, it changes the vowel sounds.","tabwords":["bear","dear","pear","tear","hear"],"colorCode":"#ad84ff","createdAt":"2016-04-11T05:58:50.107Z","updatedAt":"2016-04-11T05:58:50.107Z","incrementflag":13,"milestoneIds":["10"],"id":"570b3d1a1df04f0c123c93be","percentage":null,"status":"Active","starflag":false},{"owner":"56ce9d385beb8bc66877a8f4","badgeName":"OW Ending","assetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/OW_Ending_Web.png","disabledassetURL":"https://squarepanda-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/OW_Ending_WebDisabled.png","description":"The combination of 'O' and 'W' at the end of the word can be tricky! Parent.Notes: Player's minibadges data.

Parent.Title: Player's activity
Parent.Notes: Player's activity for all games.

Parent.Title: Player's activity
Parent.Notes: Real words played by the player for all games.

Parent.Title: Player's activity
Parent.Notes: Non sense words played by the player for all games.

Parent.Title: Player's activity
Parent.Notes: Letters placed by the player.

Parent.Title: Log API
Parent.Notes: To log how many users view their player activity

Parent.Title: User's specific data
Parent.Notes: This api is used to verify player limit. If player limit achieved then user can't add player.

Parent.Title: Application's images
Parent.Notes: To get application's player images.

Parent.Title: Create player
Parent.Notes: To create a player. In this api "imagebase64" used if image is choosen from device.

Parent.Title: Single player data
Parent.Notes: To get player details.

Parent.Title: Update player data
Parent.Notes: To edit player details.

Parent.Title: Remove player data
Parent.Notes: To delete player. Here we are assigning player to a dummy parent account.

Parent.Title: User words
Parent.Notes: To get all user created words.

Parent.Title: User's banned words
Parent.Notes: To get all user's banned words.

Parent.Title: Anatomy and bathroom words
Parent.Notes: List of all pre-defined anatomy and bathroom words.

Parent.Title: Search user word
Parent.Notes: To check the user requested word is unique. If same word exits, then response will be the word details.

Parent.Title: Bulk image upload to S3 bucket
Parent.Data Params:
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="content"; filename="1p5 (2).jpg"
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Parent.Notes: Takes image file as form-data and returns aws url.

Parent.Title: Create word
Parent.Notes: To create word with or without aws image url. This api validates the given image url is in proper aws format.

Parent.Title: Update word
Parent.Notes: To update user word and if user add new image then, "/private/:parentId/file" api will be called

Parent.Title: Update user's bathroom words
Parent.Notes: To save new changes to user's bathroom words.

Parent.Title: Update user's anatomy words
Parent.Notes: To save new changes to user's anatomy words.

Parent.Title: Fetch user settings
Parent.Notes: To get user settings data.

Parent.Title: List of missing letters
Parent.Notes: To get lost letters data.

Parent.Title: Update user details
Parent.Notes: To update user data. This api doesn't accept email and role as input.

Parent.Title: User account change password
Parent.Notes: To change password.

Parent.Title: Update missing letters
Parent.Notes: To update playset missing letters of user.

Parent.Title: Update user settings
Parent.Notes: To update user settings such as educational news, application's news and player's news.

Parent.Title: Generate new token
Parent.Notes: To generate new token for particular user and takes token as input which is about to expire.
